It belongs to the Bromeliaceae family, which includes many epiphytic and terrestrial plants. The plant is characterized by its striking, colorful inflorescences that bloom in a spiral pattern, attracting pollinators such as hummingbirds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
